page.title: 19Computers in Education
page.content: Holwell JMI School is amongst six schools within Hertfordshire which have taken part in a two year (1984-85) Project on the use of computers in Primary Schools. The Project was initiated by the Advisory Unit for Computer-Based Education in Hatfield and was intended to look at the ways in which children and teachers use computers for the purposes of handling information in school-based project work. Amongst the topics covered in Holwell School during the two years are: paper, sliding, traffic accidents, accidents in school, the history and the people of Welwyn Garden City. The Project was the first of its kind in the country and was financed by Herts CC and the Cowper foundation.
